titles.title: Iâ€“27 Numbering Act of 2023
Iâ€“27 Numbering Act of 2023
Iâ€“27 Numbering Act of 2023

To amend the Intermodal Surface Transportation Efficiency Act of 1991 to designate the Texas and New Mexico portions of the future Interstate-designated segments of the Port-to-Plains Corridor as Interstate Route 27, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Highways and Transit.
Subcommittee on Highways and Transit Discharged
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held
Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute by Voice Vote.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure. H. Rept. 118-285.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 229.

committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure
committee.activity: Reported By, Markup By, Discharged, Referred To

bill.summary:
Iâ€“27 Numbering Act of 2023
This bill designates the future interstate highway system portions of the Ports-to-Plains Corridor within the states of Texas and New Mexico as Interstate Route Iâ€“27.
In Texas, from Sterling City to Lamesa, U.S. Route 87 is designated as Interstate Route Iâ€“27E and Texas Routes 158 and 349 via Iâ€“20 are designated as Interstate Route Iâ€“27W. The bill also excludes one portion of the Texas and New Mexico corridor; U.S. Route 287 from Dumas, Texas to the border between Texas and Oklahoma is designated as Interstate Route Iâ€“127N.
